Title: Type of screen time and academic achievement in children from Australia and New Zealand: interactions with socioeconomic status
Summary of Study: Examines the association between screen time and academic achievement. Suggests that the type of screen time (educational vs. entertainment) impacts academic achievement.

Title: Effects of active video games on body composition: a randomized controlled trial
Summary of Study: Found that active video games have a small but definite effect on BMI and body composition in overweight and obese children.

Title: The global spread of type 2 diabetes mellitus in children and adolescents
Summary of Study: Discusses the global rise of type 2 diabetes in children and adolescents, which may be related to lifestyle factors such as sedentary behavior.

Title: Screen-Time Weight-loss Intervention Targeting Children at Home (SWITCH): a randomized controlled trial
Summary of Study: Aimed to reduce screen-based sedentary behaviour in children and found a favorable trend towards reduced BMI.

Title: Physical activity is low in obese New Zealand children and adolescents
Summary of Study: Found that obese children/adolescents in New Zealand had low levels of physical activity, with the vast majority not meeting national physical activity recommendations.
